This app demonstrates:

1. All parameters of `input_switch`:
   - id
   - label
   - value (initial state)
   - width

2. Various use cases:
   - Basic switch functionality
   - Width customization
   - Conditional UI rendering
   - Theme toggling
   - Input state control
   - Switch state tracking

3. Integration with other Shiny components:
   - Cards for organization
   - Reactive effects
   - DataFrames for information display
   - Conditional rendering
   - Layout management

4. Interactive features:
   - Switch state monitoring
   - Theme changes
   - Input enabling/disabling
   - Content showing/hiding

The app uses Express mode syntax and doesn't rely on external files. It creates a comprehensive demonstration of input_switch capabilities while maintaining clean, organized code structure.

To run this app, simply save it as a .py file and run it with `shiny run app.py`. The app will demonstrate all the various ways to use input_switch and its integration with other Shiny components.

Package dependencies:
- shiny
- pandas

The app is organized in a card-based layout for better visual separation of different examples and use cases. Each card demonstrates a different aspect of the input_switch functionality.
